channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Preserving George Washington's Mt. Vernon Home
channel.desc: American History TV takes a rare behind-the-scenes tour of George Washington's Mt. Vernon mansion as the house undergoes extensive work to preserve the 18th century structure, which draws one million visitors a year.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Public Affairs Events
channel.desc: Public affairs events, congressional hearings, speeches, and interviews.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Lectures in History
channel.desc: Wright State University professor Paul Lockhart teaches a class on the development of weapons technology in the American Revolution.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: Twentieth century archival films on public affairs.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: The Presidency
channel.desc: Historian Lindsay Chervinsky speaks at the Boston Athenaeum about second U.S. president and Massachusetts favorite son, John Adams; his presidency unfolds against the backdrop of the politics and personalities of the new nation.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: A National Park Service film made for the 1976 Bicentennial portrays founding fathers in Philadelphia in 1776 and 1976.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: George Washington's Mount Vernon hosts a reenactment of a Revolutionary War encampment and a battle between American colonists and British troops.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: American Artifacts
channel.desc: Curator Kimberly Ivey and historical interpreter Audrey Biser give a tour of the Governor's Palace in Williamsburg, Va., and speak about the role of the royal governor and the beginning of the American Revolution.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Andrew Wehrman, The Contagion of Liberty: The Politics of Smallpox in the American Revolution
channel.desc: Andrew Wehrman discusses how inoculation became a sought-after medical procedure in the 18th century and helped American colonists achieve independence from Great Britain; the American Revolution Institute in Washington, D.C., hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Religion in Colonial America
channel.desc: Historians and authors examine events of 1775 and daily life for colonists, on the eve of the American Revolution.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Legacy of the 1775 Battles of Lexington and Concord
channel.desc: Historians and authors examine the events of 1775 and daily life for colonists on the eve of the American Revolution.

channel.title: First Clashes of the American Revolution
channel.desc: Historians and authors examine the events of 1775 and daily life for colonists on the eve of the American Revolution.

channel.title: Local Patriot Committees on the Eve of the Revolution
channel.desc: Historians and authors examine the events of 1775 and daily life for colonists on the eve of the American Revolution.

channel.desc: George Washington's Mount Vernon hosts a reenactment of a Revolutionary War encampment and a battle between American colonists and British troops.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: John McCurdy, Vicious and Immoral
channel.desc: History professor and author John McCurdy talks about the 1774 buggery trial of British chaplain Robert Newburgh and LGBT history during the American Revolution.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: FreedomFest 2025 - Mark Skousen, The Greatest American
channel.desc: Book TV interviews authors at FreedomFest, an annual libertarian conference, held in 2025 in Palm Springs, Calif.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: FreedomFest 2025: Tim Anaya, the California Left Coast Survivor's Guide
channel.desc: Book TV interviews authors at FreedomFest, an annual libertarian conference held in 2025 in Palm Springs, California.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Ron Chernow, Mark Twain
channel.desc: Pulitzer Prize-winning biographer Ron Chernow examines the life and writing career of Samuel Langhorne Clemens, better known as author Mark Twain.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: After Words
channel.desc: Journalist Stephen Witt reports on the company Nvidia, its founder Jensen Huang and why their microchip is one of the most coveted by the world.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: FreedomFest 2025 - Mark Skousen, The Greatest American
channel.desc: Book TV interviews authors at FreedomFest, an annual libertarian conference, held in 2025 in Palm Springs, Calif.

channel.title: FreedomFest 2025: Tim Anaya, the California Left Coast Survivor's Guide
channel.desc: Book TV interviews authors at FreedomFest, an annual libertarian conference held in 2025 in Palm Springs, California.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Ron Chernow, Mark Twain
channel.desc: Pulitzer Prize-winning biographer Ron Chernow examines the life and writing career of Samuel Langhorne Clemens, better known as author Mark Twain.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: After Words
channel.desc: Journalist Stephen Witt reports on the company Nvidia, its founder Jensen Huang and why their microchip is one of the most coveted by the world.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: How the Left Lost the Working Class and How to Win Them Back
channel.desc: Social inequality scholar and University of California law professor Joan Williams talks about the politics of class and offers a blueprint forward for progressives and other liberals, who, she argues, have lost the support of the working class.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Adam Becker, More Everything Forever
channel.desc: Astrophysicist Adam Becker argues that popular beliefs in Silicon Valley about AI, space travel, and other future technologies are unscientific; the Commonwealth Club of California in San Francisco hosted this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Peniel Joseph, Freedom Season
channel.desc: History professor Peniel Joseph at University of Texas in Austin, Texas, discusses how the events of 1963 shaped the civil rights movement in the United States.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Michael Walsh, a Rage to Conquer
channel.desc: Former National Review columnist Michael Walsh talks about 12 military battles that changed the course of Western history, including the 1942 Battle of Midway and the 1944-45 Battle of the Bulge during World War II.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Bill Clinton & James Patterson, the First Gentleman
channel.desc: Former President Bill Clinton talks with his co-author James Patterson about their latest novel, "A mystery in the White House," that leads to the first gentleman on trial for murder.
